properties.How to get there: The entrance to the main car park is 1km down Kennedys Bush Road, Halswell - take the 100 bus and get off on Glovers Road
properties.Features: • From the Findlay car park, turn right onto the track that runs along the edge of the picnic area to find plenty of log rounds and a big carved log for climbing and jumping • At the back of the picnic area there's a great big hill slope for rolling and running down • Pack your gumboots and head down the vehicle track from the back of the picnic area, there's plenty of spots for water and mud play by the wetland plantings - including stepping stones across the creek!

properties.How to get there: The entrance to the main car park is 1km down Kennedys Bush Road, Halswell - take the 100 bus and get off on Glovers Road
properties.Features: • From the main car park, take the path over the wooden bridge to find lots of meandering paths through the plantings to explore • The park rangers have placed logs in the grass - have a rummage and dig around to find insects and maybe even a lizard! • The pond in the centre is full of wetland birds and eel/tuna - see what you can spot!

properties.How to get there: End of Rocking Horse Road, Southshore - take the number 60 bus to Southshore at the end of the line
properties.Features: • There's lots of winding tracks for running and exploring • Try hiding out in the long grass • Easy beach access for water play and digging in the sand • Easy access to the Ihutai/Avon Heathcote Estuary for mud-crab spotting • Lots of wading birds to spot - don't forget your binoculars!

properties.How to get there: Beside Greenaway Park, Greenaway Street, Halswell - take the Orbitor bus to Greenway Park
properties.Features: • Purpose built nature play reserve • Climbing logs • Log rounds to jump on • Lots of tall grass and plantings to explore and hide among • Wooden beams to balance on

properties.How to get there: Worsleys Road, Cashmere - take the 145 bus to Cashmere Road near Marvin Road
properties.Features: • A beautiful stream to splash in or watch • New plantings to explore • Birds to watch • Big heritage oak tree leaves to jump in during autumn

properties.How to get there: Worsleys Road, Cashmere - take the 145 bus to Cashmere Road near Marvin Road
properties.Features: • A beautiful stream to splash in or watch • New plantings to explore • Birds to watch • An easy, sealed path to follow the river along

properties.How to get there: Worsleys Road, Cashmere - take the 145 bus to Woodside Common near Ravensdale Rise
properties.Features: • A beautiful stream to splash in or watch • Birds to watch • Winding paths through the plantings to explore

properties.How to get there: Hillsborough Terrace, Hillsborough - take the 145 bus to Hillsborough Terrace
properties.Features: • Large areas of tussock planting which is great for swishing through • Caves! From the car park, take the right fork up through the trees on Dry Ridge Track to reach a cave overhang. It's about a ten minute walk uphill for little legs

properties.How to get there: Ferrymead Park Drive, Ferrymead - take the 535 bus to Bridle Path Road
properties.Features: • Ponds with lots of ducks and other wetland birds for watching • Spot insects hanging out on wetland plants like harakeke/flax and rushes • Beside the Ferrymead Sports Pavilion there's a 'pump track' dirt circuit for biking (or running!) around • Horses and historic trams to spot!
